meanings.definition: A specialized language or set of terms used by a particular group or profession.
meanings.sent1: The thieves used their own argots to discuss their plans without others understanding.
meanings.sent2: In the medical field, doctors often use argots that can be confusing to patients.
meanings.sent3: The secret agent's argots were so complex that even his colleagues had trouble deciphering them.
meanings.sent4: The world of coding has its own argots that can seem like a foreign language to outsiders.
meanings.sent5: Learning the argots of a new industry can be challenging but rewarding.

meanings.definition: Jargon or slang used by a specific group to communicate among themselves.
meanings.sent1: Teenagers often develop their own argots to communicate with each other.
meanings.sent2: The argots of gamers can be difficult for non-players to understand.
meanings.sent3: The chefs in the kitchen had a playful argots that made cooking more fun.
meanings.sent4: The fashion industry's argots can change rapidly with each new trend.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the argots of different subcultures can help bridge communication gaps.
